p: Many laboratories have attempted to isolate favipiravir-resistant influenza viruses but have not been successful. Recently, mutants of influenza virus ( Goldhill et al., 2018) and chikungunya virus ( Abdelnabi et al., 2017; Delang et al., 2014) that are less susceptible to favipiravir have been reported. Mutated sequences of these viruses have been detected in cultures treated with favipiravir, and reverse-engineered viruses showed favipiravir resistance with altered RdRp activity related to the fidelity and reduced growth property.
